wikipedia_page.main:
Roger Pusey is a former BBC Radio 1 producer who worked on the Peel Sessions. He was previously producer of the station's Tony Blackburn morning show.He produced versions of a number of tracks for The Smiths including "This Charming Man", "What Difference Does It Make", and "This Night Has Opened My Eyes" on the compilation albums: Hatful of Hollow and Louder Than Bombs.
In addition, Pusey produced tracks for David Bowie and New Model Army.In 2010 he co-produced the debut EP Atlas by singer-songwriter Joshua Fisher.

response: *Roger Pusey – producer ("Smalltown England", "Spirit of the Falklands", "Christian Militia", "Running in the Rain")

His debut EP, "Atlas" was scheduled to be released on 25 October 2010 by independent London based label Polymorph Records.  "Atlas" features four songs, which have been co-produced by Roger Pusey – former producer of The Smiths albums Hatful of Hollow and Louder Than Bombs.
Their most recent release is by singer-songwriter Joshua Fisher who released his debut EP "Atlas" on 25 October 2010.  It was co-produced by Roger Pusey.
